skill.name: software-engineer
skill.description: Builds and refactors code safely; prefers small diffs, clear validation steps, and testable outcomes.
skill.summary: Builds and refactors code safely; prefers small diffs, clear validation steps, and testable outcomes...
skill.author: ACSKamloops

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill definition containing only behavioral guidelines. No executable code, no file access, no network operations, no code execution paths. Safe for installation.

content.user_title: Build and refactor code with safe practices
content.value_statement: Writing and modifying code carries risks of bugs, regressions, and security issues. This skill guides AI assistants to make minimal, reviewable changes with proper validation, ensuring code quality and safety.
actual_capabilities: Creates small, focused code changes that are easy to review
Asks clarifying questions when requirements are ambiguous
Follows existing repository patterns and coding conventions
Proposes validation steps like tests or build commands
Avoids destructive actions without explicit user approval
limitations: Does not execute code or run tests automatically
Cannot access external APIs or documentation directly
Limited to existing repository patterns and dependencies
Relies on user to approve and apply suggested changes

use_cases.title: Code Review Assistant
use_cases.description: Generates reviewable code changes with clear validation steps and test suggestions.

use_cases.title: Quality Guardrails
use_cases.description: Ensures AI contributions follow team patterns and require proper testing.

use_cases.title: Learning Tool
use_cases.description: Models best practices for safe refactoring and incremental development.

prompt_templates.title: Add Feature
prompt_templates.prompt: Add a user authentication module to our API. Follow the existing patterns in the codebase and suggest a quick test to verify it works.

prompt_templates.title: Refactor Code
prompt_templates.prompt: Refactor the data processing function to use async/await. Keep the changes minimal and propose how to validate the behavior remains the same.

prompt_templates.title: Fix Bug
prompt_templates.prompt: Fix the memory leak in the connection pool. Ask any clarifying questions you need and suggest a validation approach.

prompt_templates.title: Add Tests
prompt_templates.prompt: Add unit tests for the payment processing module. Follow the testing patterns already established in the project.

output_examples.input: Add logging to track API request duration
output: I'll add minimal, focused logging with the existing logger pattern
I'll propose a quick test to verify the timing is captured correctly
Before making changes, I have one question: should the log level be info or debug?

best_practices: Start with small, reviewable changes rather than large rewrites
Ask clarifying questions when requirements are unclear or ambiguous
Always validate changes through tests, builds, or focused commands
anti_patterns: Making large, monolithic changes without incremental validation
Skipping clarification and making assumptions about requirements
Applying changes without proposing how to verify correctness

faq.question: Which AI platforms support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Installation varies by platform.

faq.question: What are the limits on change size?
faq.answer: The skill encourages minimal diffs under 400 lines. Larger changes should be split into reviewable chunks.

faq.question: Does this integrate with my existing CI/CD?
faq.answer: The skill suggests validation commands but does not execute CI/CD pipelines directly.

faq.question: Is my code data safe?
faq.answer: This is a prompt-only skill. No code leaves your environment. All processing happens locally through your AI tool.

faq.question: What if changes break existing functionality?
faq.answer: The skill requires validation steps before changes. Users must approve and run tests themselves.

faq.question: How does this compare to manual coding?
faq.answer: This skill adds discipline to AI-assisted coding. It does not replace human review or decision-making.
